Title: Producer Vibez unveils new label, VMF
Summary: Alexander Uwaifo known in the music industry as Andre Vibez has launched a new record label . The producer behind Rema’s hit song, Calm Down, and Rush from Ayra Starr's album, 19 & Dangerous, has unveiled a new label, VMF .

Title: Burna Boy, Travis Scott in new single, Tatata, drop music video
Summary: Grammy Award-winning artiste, Damini Ebunoluwa Ogulu, better known as Burna Boy keeps building momentum toward his much-anticipated eighth studio album, No Sign of Weakness . The explosive new single, TaTaTa, features diamond-certified, 10 times Grammy-nominated rapper Travis Scott .

Title: FG prioritising digital inclusion with renewed investment – Minister
Summary: Federal Government reiterates commitment to bridging Nigeria’s digital divide . Ministry of Communications, Innovation, and Digital Economy has renewed focus on sustainability and partnerships .

Title: How IFDC interventions improve Nigeria’s farming practices on food production
Summary: Nigeria has a total agricultural land area of about 70.8 million hectares, and arable land estimated at 36.87 million hectares . Nigeria is considered capable of producing enough for the populace .

Title: The return of Okada menace in Lagos
Summary: Lagos State Task Force recently announced clampdown on commercial motorcycles . For months, the recalcitrant motorcyclists have gradually defied the restriction placed on them .

Title: FG to commission ‘completed part’ of phase one Lagos-Calabar Coastal highway today
Summary: The Minister of Works, Engr. Dave Umahi has disclosed that the completed part of Phase I, Section I (30 km of 750 km) of the Lagos-Calabar Coastal Highway will be commissioned on Saturday .

Title: SSCE 2025: ‘Expo’ on a silver platter as WAEC attempts to prevent English paper leakage?
Summary: WAEC's English Language paper was most embarrassing and unfortunate, one should be laughing hysterically . If not that what happened on Wednesday regarding the 2025 SSCE English language paper was embarrassing . WAEC attempts to prevent English paper leakage?

Title: Why Nigerians are losing confidence in govt – Okwesilieze Nwodo
Summary: Armed groups operating under guise of separatist movements have imposed illegal sit-at-home orders, which have disrupted daily life . Armed groups operate under the guise of separatists movements .

Title: Killer-voodoo men on the prowl, tension spreads
Summary: Before their arrest, the three men dominated social media, where they advertised their juju business . 18 pastors out of the 53 profiled fled their residences .

Title: Democracy in the hands of the judiciary
Summary: To be sure, courts always have a legitimate role in the democratic process . This was so well before Nigeria embarked on the experiment in presidential politics .

Title: Visa crackdown: You'll be fine, Trump tells Chinese students in US
Summary: US President Donald Trump said Friday he wanted to assure Chinese international students in the country that they would be fine amid his administration’s crackdown on academia . Trump administration has been in an ongoing showdown with academia, and Harvard in particular, demanding it provide a list of students that the government is interested in, something the prestigious university has declined

Title: 2026: Defection won’t affect Adeleke’s victory – PDP chair
Summary: Osun State Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party, Sunday Bisi, declared that the defection of members of the party to the All Progressives Congress will not stop Governor Ademola Adeleke from winning his re-election in 2026 . Bisi described the defections as “a storm in a teacup�

Title: Fatal marriage rivalry: When quiet wars in polygamous homes turn fatal
Summary: In homes where multiple wives are confined together with little privacy, unequal affection from the husband or competition over children and resources can ignite tensions . What is meant to be a union of harmony, built on Islamic principles of equity, can deteriorate into rivalry, jealousy, and even death .

Title: My son who died in Lagos building collapse scored 320 in UTME – Driver
Summary: Saheed Akeredolu tells GRACE EDEMA how he lost two children and an uncle during the incident . He says the children were praying in the unfinished building when the building collapsed . The building owner says he used high-quality materials and the government gave him approval at every stage .

Title: Five ways to prepare daughters for menstruation
Summary: The onset of menstruation, also known as menarche, is a significant milestone in a girl's journey to womanhood . For many, the first period can be accompanied by anxiety, confusion, and fear . Experts say that open communication, accurate information, and emotional support are key tools mothers can use to guide their daughters through this
